intro: Thlaspi exauriculatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils. The plant has alternate, narrow leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in alpine and arctic regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Thlaspi exauriculatum is known for its ability to tolerate harsh conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
